useClamp.description: Clamp integer state within dynamic ranges
useClamp.example:
const clamp = useClamp({ 
 min: 1, 
 max: 10, 
 value: 5,
 useExpected: true
})

<button onClick={() => clamp.setValue(12)}>Clamp Value</button>

items: Pass the expected value to the state setter callback (optional, default false)
Function to set new minimum bound
Function to set new maximum bound

useClickOutside.description: Handle click events outside of referenced elements
useClickOutside.jsdoc:
/**
 * [useClickOutside](https://hooks.pratiq.dev/docs/hooks/useClickOutside)
 * 
 * Handle click events outside of referenced elements
 * ________________________________________________________________________
 * @param
 * | keys           | type          | description                       |
 * | :--            |:--            |:--                                |
 * | **callback**   | `() => void`  | The callback function to invoke   |
 * ________________________________________________________________________
 * @returns 
 * | keys           | type                                  | description |
 * |:--             |:--                                    |:--                                                               |                           
 * | **clickOut**   | `(el: HTMLElement | null) => void`    | A function used as a react ref for adding the current element    |           
 * ________________________________________________________________________
 * @interface
 * ```
 * export namespace UseClickOutside {
 *   export type Callback = (e: MouseEvent) => void;
 *   export type Return = (el: HTMLElement | null) => void;
 *   export interface Hook {
 *     (): Return;
 *     (callback: Callback): Return;
 *   }
 * }
 * ```
 * ________________________________________________________________________
 * @example
 * const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState<boolean>(false)
 * 
 * const clickOut = useClickOutside(() => {
 *  setIsOpen(false)
 * })
 * 
 * <button ref={clickOut} onClick={() => setIsOpen(true)}>Open</button>
 * <button ref={clickOut}>Safe to Click</button>
 */

items: A function used as a react ref for adding the current element

useClipboard.description: Copy text to and read from the clients clipboard

items: The delay in ms before flash boolean reset to false
The current value of the clipboard
Copy a string to the clipboard
True if the value was copied successfully
True if successfully copied, resets to false after `flashTime` (default: 1000ms)

useCssVariables.example:
const elementRef = useRef()
const [css, update] = useCssVariables('--cust', elementRef)

isBrowser.description: Check if the current environment is browser vs SSR
